concept.title: X-Window software packages
concept.shortdesc: X-Window consists of the following three main packages: the X-Window Server, X-Window Client, and Field Communications Server. These packages interact with each other to achieve the overall functionality of X-Window.

section.title: Basic X-Window software packages
section.p: X-Window consists of the following three main software packages.

ul.li:
X-Window Server
The X-Window server collects the field device information and saves the information in the database. The information saved within X-Window server includes messages, device parameters, and inspection information used in device management as well as other related information.

X-Window Client
The X-Window Client is a graphical user interface application used to communicate with the whole of X-Window. Using the X-Window Client, you can view device information, monitor device statuses, and perform various operations related to device management.

Field Communications Server
The Field Communications Server collects information from field devices, which are displayed on X-Window Client. The information can then be stored in the X-Window Server.

section.title: Extended X-Window software packages
section.p: The following optional packages provide additional X-Window functionalities.

ul.li: PAA Development Kit (PAA: X-Window Advanced Diagnostic Application Development Kit)
